alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 2:41PM MST until March 23 at 5:34AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Flagstaff AZ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. .Heavy rain and melting snow have lead to fast rising flows in rivers which will reach critical levels. For the Oak Creek...including Cornville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. At 12.0 feet, Significant flooding of RV park near Page Springs Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:16 PM MST Tuesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 14.8 feet late this evening. It will fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.2 feet on 02/20/1993. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Oak Creek Cornvill 8.0 7.7 Tue 2 pm MST 11.2 5.8 4.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM MST.
